privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.metaDescription: Learn how Ace-Stats handles your data and protects your privacy.
privacy.paragraph1: This app does not collect, store, or transmit users' personal data to external servers or third parties.
privacy.paragraph2: All data generated by the app, such as match statistics and sports records, is stored exclusively on the user's device.
privacy.paragraph3: The app does not use user accounts, does not require login, and does not perform any tracking, behavior analysis, or automatic collection of personal information.
privacy.paragraph4: Data sharing, when available, occurs only at the user's explicit initiative through the operating system's native tools (for example, exporting or manually sharing files). The app does not control or store this information after sharing.
privacy.paragraph5: The app does not display ads and does not use third-party services to collect data.
privacy.contactText: If you have questions or requests related to privacy, you can contact us at:
privacy.updates: This policy may be updated in the future to reflect improvements or changes to the app.

watches.question: Which watches does it work on?
watches.answer: Ace-Stats works on any smartwatch with WearOS 2.0 or higher, including Samsung Galaxy Watch 4/5/6, Google Pixel Watch, TicWatch and other compatible devices.

cancel.question: Can I cancel anytime?
cancel.answer: Yes! The Ace Pro plan can be cancelled at any time, without fees or penalties. You'll continue to have access until the end of the paid period.

freeForever.question: Is the Free plan really free forever?
freeForever.answer: Yes, absolutely! The Free plan allows unlimited recording of matches and rivals forever. No tricks, no temporary limitations.

dataSync.question: How does data synchronization work?
dataSync.answer: After each match, you can export data from the watch to the web platform via Bluetooth or Wi-Fi. Synchronization takes just a few seconds.

meta.title: Watch Screens | Ace-Stats
meta.description: Explore all watch features in Ace-Stats: quick setup, advanced rules, simple and advanced modes, history, and full match statistics.

hero.title: Watch Screens & Features
hero.subtitle: A complete view of how Ace-Stats turns your smartwatch into a match control center. Fast to set up, precise to measure.

matchSetup.title: Match Setup
matchSetup.intro: The Ace-Stats home screen is built for speed. In tennis, every rest second matters, so you set the rules in under 5 seconds.

gamesPerSet.label: Games per Set:
gamesPerSet.text: Define the length of each set (4, 6, or 8 games).

superTieBreak.label: Super Tie-break Mode:
superTieBreak.text: Selecting 1 set of 4 games automatically switches to Short Set / Super Tie-break mode.

enableTieBreak.label: Enable Tie-break:
enableTieBreak.text: Enable or disable the tie-break if the set reaches a regulation tie.

iServeFirst.label: I Serve First:
iServeFirst.text: Defines who serves first to keep service rotation accurate from point one.

history.label: History:
history.text: Review recent matches and technical evolution.

advancedSettings.title: Customization & Advanced Rules
advancedSettings.intro: Ace-Stats adapts to your level and the detail you want. In settings, you control the interface and match rules.

simple.label: Simple Mode (2 buttons):
simple.text: Tap who won the point and let the watch handle the score.

advanced.label: Advanced Mode (6 buttons):
advanced.text: Track winners, unforced errors, aces, and double faults.

setTieBreak.label: Set Tie-break Points:
setTieBreak.text: Choose 5, 7, or 10 points for the set tie-break.

finalSet.label: Final Set (Decision):
finalSet.text: Play a full set or a Match Tie-break to decide the match.

trackFirstServe.label: Track First Serve:
trackFirstServe.text: Record whether the point came from a first or second serve.

setFormat.label: Set Format:
setFormat.text: Full Set tie-break at target or Short Set with an earlier tie-break.

history.title: History & Evolution
history.intro: It’s not enough to play; you need to analyze. The Last Matches screen stores your last 3 matches for quick review.

detail.label: Details:
detail.text: See date, time, and final score for each match.

share.label: Sharing:
share.text: Each match generates a unique link to share your stats.

clean.label: Data Management:
clean.text: Use the Clean button to clear your history.

interface.title: Game Interface: Total Control on Your Wrist
interface.intro: Ace-Stats is designed to keep your focus on the ball. The interface is intuitive and lets you record points without staring at the watch.

opponentPoint.label: Opponent Point:
opponentPoint.text: Tap the upper half of the screen.

yourPoint.label: Your Point:
yourPoint.text: Tap the lower half of the screen.

serveGuide.label: Serve Guide:
serveGuide.text: Shows the server and the correct court side (Deuce or Ad).

pauseMenu.label: Pause Menu:
pauseMenu.text: Press and hold the center for 2 seconds.

resume.label: Resume:
resume.text: Return to the match right where you left off.

history.label: History:
history.text: Check point history for the current match.

finish.label: Finish Match:
finish.text: End the match and save the final data.

restart.label: Restart:
restart.text: Restart the match or return to setup.

matchStats.title: 4. Match Statistics
matchStats.text: See how your game is going with break-point metrics, first-serve percentage, errors, and winners. Adjust your strategy point by point.

advancedMode.title: Advanced Mode: Pro-Level Statistics
advancedMode.intro: For those who want more than a score. The advanced mode (6 buttons) turns your watch into a complete tennis scout.

aces.label: Aces & Double Faults:
aces.text: Control serve efficiency on the right side.

serveControl.label: 1st & 2nd Serve:
serveControl.text: The Serve F button toggles to D. Fault and changes color.

orientation.label: Visual Orientation:
orientation.text: The server icon shows the correct side (Deuce or Ad).

unforced.label: Unforced Error:
unforced.text: A ball you should not have missed.

return.label: Return Error:
return.text: A mistake specifically on the return.

baseline.label: Baseline:
baseline.text: Forehand or backhand winners during rallies.

returnWinner.label: Return Winner:
returnWinner.text: A return that ends the point.
